message: For example, I started a group called UX/UI and someone else created User Experience - these might be better as one
Not if there's content you would think is valuable to both 'duplicate' groups
I see, so you'd be merging over members and content
Say you make a group only to find out it's already been done.
Request admin of other group to merge your group with theirs, or the other way around.
We'll definitely be looking into ways to make this better
We really didn't anticipate the problem of conflicting groups being created--we were concerned nobody would create groups, and now we've got a problem on the other end of the spectrum, haha :)

I created http://convore.com/cxx, and while I did search beforehand, missed http://convore.com/c-1; both were named C++. just providing feedback on duplicate groups, because the latter is empty (and the former barely has anything yet). I suggested abandoning the one instead of bothering admins to merge
@rdpate the bottom line is we need more uptake. There are only about a dozen groups with regular activity.
